mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.accumulo

Interface AccumuloOperations

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataStoreOperations
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicAccumuloOperations

    public interface AccumuloOperations
extends DataStoreOperations
    This interface is used as a basis for establishing connections for queries and ingest processes used by the index classes. Operations are configured to a specific 'table' name space.

      • createBatchDeleter

        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.BatchDeleter createBatchDeleter(String tableName,
                                                                String... additionalAuthorizations)
                                                         throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Creates a new batch deleter that can be used by an index
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        additionalAuthorizations - additional authorizations
        Returns:
        The appropriate batch deleter
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • createTable

        void createTable(String tableName,
                 boolean enableVersioning,
                 boolean enableBlockCache,
                 Set<ByteArrayId> splits)
        Creates a table for an index
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        enableVersioning - If true the versioning iterator will be used.
        enableBlockCache - Will set the default property for accumulo block cache if the table is created
        splits - If the table is created, these splits will be added as partition keys. Null can be used to imply not to add any splits.

      • createWriter

        Writer createWriter(String tableName)
             throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Creates a new writer that can be used by an index. The basic implementation uses a BatchWriter but other implementations can be replaced such as a context-based writer for bulk ingest within a map-reduce job. A table is created by default if it does not exist with no custom iterators.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        Returns:
        The appropriate writer
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • createWriter

        Writer createWriter(String tableName,
                    boolean createTable)
             throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Creates a new writer that can be used by an index. The basic implementation uses a BatchWriter but other implementations can be replaced such as a context-based writer for bulk ingest within a map-reduce job. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The appropriate writer
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • createWriter

        Writer createWriter(String tableName,
                    boolean createTable,
                    boolean enableVersioning,
                    boolean enableBlockCache,
                    Set<ByteArrayId> splits)
             throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Creates a new writer that can be used by an index. The basic implementation uses a BatchWriter but other implementations can be replaced such as a context-based writer for bulk ingest within a map-reduce job. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist. This will also use the enableVersioning flag to determine if the versioning iterator should be used. Additionally it will add the provided splits on creation of the table only.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        enableVersioning - If true the versioning iterator will be used.
        enableBlockCache - Will set the default property for accumulo block cache if the table is created
        splits - If the table is created, these splits will be added as partition keys. Null can be used to imply not to add any splits.
        Returns:
        The appropriate writer
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • attachIterators

        boolean attachIterators(String tableName,
                        boolean createTable,
                        boolean enableVersioning,
                        boolean enableBlockCache,
                        Set<ByteArrayId> splits,
                        IteratorConfig... iterators)
                 throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Attaches the iterators to the specified table. This will check if the scope is the same and if the options are the same. If the options are different, it will use the implementation of IteratorConfig.mergeOptions() to perform the merge. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        enableVersioning - If true the versioning iterator will be used.
        enableBlockCache - Will set the default property for accumulo block cache if the table is created
        splits - If the table is created, these splits will be added as partition keys. Null can be used to imply not to add any splits.
        iterators - the iterators to attach
        Returns:
        A flag indicating whether the iterator was successfully attached.
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • addSplits

        void addSplits(String tableName,
               boolean createTable,
               Set<ByteArrayId> splits)
        throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException,
               org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException,
               org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException
        Add the splits to the specified table. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        splits - the splits to add to the given table
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException

      • deleteTable

        boolean deleteTable(String tableName)
        Drops the table with the given name (the basic implementation will use a table namespace prefix if given). Returns whether the table was found and the operation completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        Returns:
        Returns true if the table was found and dropped, false if it was not found or not dropped successfully

      • localityGroupExists

        boolean localityGroupExists(String tableName,
                            byte[] localityGroup)
                     throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException,
                            org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Checks for the existence of the locality group with the given name, within the table of the given name
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        localityGroup - The name of the locality group
        Returns:
        Returns true if the locality group was found, false if it was not found
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException

                      org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException
        Adds the locality group with the given name to the table of the given name
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        localityGroup - The name of the locality group
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException

      • delete

        boolean delete(String tableName,
               ByteArrayId rowId,
               String columnFamily,
               String columnQualifier,
               String... additionalAuthorizations)
        Drops the specified row from the specified table. Returns whether the operation completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to delete from, this must be provided
        rowId - the row ID to delete, this must be provided
        columnFamily - the column family of the row to delete, this can be null to delete the whole row
        columnQualifier - the column qualifier for a given column family to delete, this can be null to delete the whole column family
        additionalAuthorizations - checks authorizations
        Returns:
        Returns true if the row deletion didn't encounter any errors, false if nothing was found or the row was not dropped successfully

      • delete

        boolean delete(String tableName,
               List<ByteArrayId> rowId,
               String columnFamily,
               String columnQualifier,
               String... additionalAuthorizations)
        Drops the specified row from the specified table. Returns whether the operation completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to delete from, this must be provided
        rowIds - the row ID to delete, this must be provided
        columnFamily - the column family of the row to delete, this can be null to delete the whole row
        columnQualifier - the column qualifier for a given column family to delete, this can be null to delete the whole column family
        additionalAuthorizations - checks authorizations
        Returns:
        Returns true if the row deletion didn't encounter any errors, false if nothing was found or the row was not dropped successfully

        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to delete from, this must be provided
        columnFamily - the column family of the row to delete, this can be null to delete the whole row
        additionalAuthorizations - checks authorizations
        Returns:
